case_vignette: A 67-year-old-male farmer presents complaining of a growing mole on the right side of his cheek.   He states the mole was present for several years, but then started growing rapidly on one side a few weeks ago. Sometimes the mole will bleed on its own. He tries to avoid picking at the area.   Physical examination shows tan-brown ovoid irreuglarly shaped hyperpigmented macule with focal ulcearion. Dermoscopy demonstrates a blue-gray veil in the center of the lesion.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got this mole on my right cheek that has started growing quickly on one side in the last few weeks, and sometimes it just starts bleeding all by itself.
How old are you?
I am 67 years old.
Have you had any skin cancer in the past?
No, I haven't had skin cancer before.
Do you have a family history of skin cancer?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.
I apologize for the assumption. Does anyone in your family have a history of skin cancer?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.
I apologize for asking an inappropriate question. Do you have any other symptoms apart from the mole growing quickly and bleeding?
No, just the growing mole that sometimes bleeds.
Are you currently taking any medications or supplements?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications or supplements.
I apologize for assuming, can you tell me if you are currently taking any medications or supplements?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications or supplements.
I apologize for assuming. Thank you for your patience. Based on your symptoms, it is imperative that you see a doctor in person. **Final Diagnosis:** Suspicious melanocytic nevus or melanoma.
